Bootstrap Framework for Statistical P-value Calculations

Source: R/bootstrap_framework.R
bootstrap_framework.Rd

This module provides bootstrap-based methods for calculating p-values and performing hypothesis tests, especially for situations where analytical distributions are unknown or complex.

Usage

bootstrap_p_value(
  data,
  test_statistic,
  observed_stat = NULL,
  n_bootstraps = 10000,
  alternative = "two.sided",
  progress = TRUE,
  seed = NULL
)

Arguments

data

Numeric vector of observations

test_statistic

Function that computes the test statistic from data

observed_stat

The observed test statistic (if NULL, will be computed)

n_bootstraps

Number of bootstrap samples (default: 10000)

alternative

Character string specifying the alternative hypothesis: "two.sided", "less", or "greater" (default: "two.sided")

progress

Logical; show progress bar for long computations (default: TRUE)

seed

Random seed for reproducibility (default: NULL)

Value

A list containing:

p.value

The bootstrap p-value

bootstrap_stats

Vector of bootstrap test statistics

observed_stat

The observed test statistic

n_bootstraps

Number of bootstrap samples used

Details

The framework includes:

  • Bootstrap p-value calculation using resampling

  • Permutation testing for non-parametric hypothesis tests

  • Monte Carlo p-value estimation via simulation

These methods are particularly useful for compression tests and other statistical tests where the null distribution is not well-defined.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Test if mean differs from 0.5
x <- runif(100)
stat_func <- function(d) mean(d) - 0.5
result <- bootstrap_p_value(x, stat_func)
print(result$p.value)
} # }
